newsitem.title: USA: U.S. lead production rises in July - ABMS.
newsitem.headline: U.S. lead production rises in July - ABMS.

text.p: U.S. lead production in July rose to 28,153 short tons versus 23,891 short tons in June and 34,138 tons in July 1995, while inventories have also risen, American Bureau of Metal Statistics reported.
In January through July, U.S. refined lead production totalled 219,688 tons, down from 240,250 tons in the same period last year.

Shipments of lead in the U.S. fell to 213,171 tons in the first seven months of the year compared to 227,219 tons last year. Shipments from U.S. producers fell to 200,336 tons in January to July this year from 214,882 tons in 1995.
Inventories held by U.S. lead refineries at their own plants and elsewhere rose to 21,906 tons in July compared to 21,582 tons in June, and 23,485 tons in July 1995.
U.S. producer lead inventories have risen 6,216 tons in the first seven months of the year.
